page.title: 02Timber.Welbeck Estate
page.content: Much of the area owned by the Welbeck Estate Company is dominated by woodland. This woodland is used for felling. The timber felling process takes place under the 'Basis Two Dedication Plan.' This means that the W.E.C. must state their plans for the next five years to the local council for its approval. The trees are allowed to grow for 22 years after planting before they are cut down. This is done in a series of 3 five_yearly thinnings. In the first thinning every third row of trees is cut down, for the second thinning every other row is removed and for the third (37 years after planting) all the remaining trees are removed. After 50 years the plantation is replaced , giving the soil 13 years to recover.
